item.description:
The Boston Israel Cleantech Alliance is proud to sponsor this event at MIT Sloan featuring Larry Loev, the Director of Business Development (Physical Sciences) at Ramot, the technology transfer company of Tel Aviv University.

As Director of Business Development at Ramot, Mr. Loev works with entrepreneurs and industrial partners to commercialize a portfolio of 100 technologies related to cleantech, medical devices, communications, optics, and electronics. Mr. Loev will share his perspective on the challenges and keys to success in commercializing energy and cleantech technology.

Agenda:
8:00-8:15am Networking & Intros (Breakfast and Coffee)
8:15-9:00am Presentation and Q&A
9:00-9:30am Member Announcements & Networking

Thank you to our co-organizers and sponsors: MISTI - MIT Israel Program and Combined Jewish Philanthropies.

An MIT campus map is available online at http://mitsloan.mit.e...
Information about parking at MIT is available online at http://www.talentforu...


Larry Loev

Mr. Larry Loev, Director of Business Development (Physical Sciences) at Ramot, is responsible for business development in the areas of engineering, computer and exact sciences at Tel Aviv University.

Mr. Loev holds an M.Sc. degree in Applied Physics from the Hebrew University in Jerusalem. Larry has a broad background in the Israeli hi tech industry, filling positions as engineer and project manager and gaining experience in varied technologies such as thin film FAB, CO2 lasers, image processing, thermo-optical selective coatings and electro-optic diagnostic devices. From 1995 to 1998, Larry was general manager of CEFAR, a start-up developing innovative image capture cards. Before joining Ramot in 2006, Larry was R&D manager at Medical Enterprises, a medical device company developing equipment for treating bladder cancer.
item.name: Cleantech R&D and Tech Transfer at Tel Aviv University
